t440.text: There are games where you can play nonhuman species or entities that don't have bioessentialism or even the ableist assumptions of the core ability scores of d&d. Just because it's the corporate brand with the most financial backing, doesn't mean it's the best or only game.

t441.text: I'm not saying you're bad for liking d&d. I'm saying look at the things you like through a critical lens, & consider who profits from your devoted defense of them. Also be careful you're not talking down the MRA hole. Only misery & bitterness lies there.

t442.text: Those mechanics have bioessentialism & colonialism baked in. Even if a group goes through all the work to excise all the garbage assumptions in d&d's fiction, they're still toiling under the yoke of those mechanics.

t445.text: That's right same in Australia Doctors have no obligation to prescribe cross sex hormones or puberty blockers and pharmacists don't have to dispense them Patients asking for them are referred to a psychologist

t446.text: I've already pointed out that colonialism is baked into the rules of d&d. Besides, an individual GM stripping out the racism written into the games fiction doesn't give the game designers & writers a free pass for continuing the shitty tropes gygax wrote.

t452.text: D&D is like if someone said "hey what if phrenology was real?"

t454.text: Its not lore, it's mechanics & the premise of the game. Like "mental" attributes are generally pretty ableist, but then have a layer of bioessentialism applied to them when you start saying this species is inherently less intelligent in the mechanics.

t455.text: The entire premise of how d&d leverages violence against the other is inherently colonialist. At best it paints murder tourists & tomb robbers as heroes. There's a strong note of exceptionalism & "might makes right" built into the powerful PCs as saviours it's hard to get past.

t456.text: It's also rubbish because it denies normal development and you don't get a second chance

t457.text: Agreed. The others are more unpleasant and malicious, but also much more aggressive and dangerous.

t458.text: High school! Bought it after watching my little bro play soccer, then raced my sister to the end (she won)
